name.namePart: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: USA v. Stewart
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Shawn A. Stewart (1) - Defendant pleaded guilty to count I of the Indictment and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for a term of 42 months; 3 years supervised with special conditions; $100 special assessment. Count II of the Indictment is dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this defendant only, as to defendant Shawn A. Stewart. Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 5/5/2005. 5 certified copies USM (JAE, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: USA v. Stewart
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER FOR DISMISSAL - Leave of Court is granted for the United States to dismiss, without prejudice, the Petition 28 for Offender Under Supervision filed herein. The Motion 30 for Dismissal is sustained. The Indictment filed herein is hereby dismissed, without prejudice, as it pertains to thedefendant Shawn A. Stewart (1). Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (1 Certified copy to USM)( JAE, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER FOR DISMISSAL - Leave of Court is granted for the United States to dismiss, without prejudice, the Petition 28 for Offender Under Supervision filed herein. The Motion 30 for Dismissal is sustained. The Indictment filed herein is hereby dismissed, without prejudice, as it pertains to thedefendant Shawn A. Stewart (1). Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (1 Certified copy to USM)( JAE, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Stewart
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER APPOINTING COUNSEL - Deborah D. Cunningham is appointed as counsel for defendant Shawn A. Stewart. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (JAE)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Stewart
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendant Shawn A. Stewart. The government's oral motion for detention is granted. The defendant is committed to the custody of the Attorney General or his designated representative for confinement in a correctional facility. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (1 Certified copy to USM)( MLF, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER as to defendant Shawn A. Stewart. The government's oral motion for detention is granted. (1 Certified copy to USM)( MLF, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Stewart
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER denying 56 Motion for Reconsideration as to Shawn A. Stewart (1). Pursuant to NECrimR 57.2, a party may appeal this order by filing a "Statement of Appeal of Magistrate Judge's Order" within ten (10) business days after being served with the order. The party shall specifically state the order or portion thereof appealed from and the basis of the appeal. The appealing party shall file contemporaneously with the statement of appeal a brief setting forth the party's arguments that the magistrate judge's order is clearly erroneous or contrary to law. The filing of a statement of appeal does not automatically stay the magistrate judge's order pending appeal. See NECrimR 57.2.. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (MKR)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER denying 56 Motion for Reconsideration as to Shawn A. Stewart (1). Pursuant to NECrimR 57.2, a party may appeal this order by filing a "Statement of Appeal of Magistrate Judge's Order" within ten (10) business days after being served with the order. The party shall specifically state the order or portion thereof appealed from and the basis of the appeal. The appealing party shall file contemporaneously with the statement of appeal a brief setting forth the party's arguments that the magistrate judge's order is clearly erroneous or contrary to law. The filing of a statement of appeal does not automatically stay the magistrate judge's order pending appeal. See NECrimR 57.2.. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (MKR)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Stewart
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER that defendant's attorney is authorized to retain a mental health professional to perform a presentence neuropsyhological evaluation of the defendant and to prepare a written report of the findings as to defendant Shawn A. Stewart. The US Marshal is directed to hold the defendant in the Douglas County, Nebraska - Council Bluffs, Iowa area until completion of the evaluation. The evaluation should be completed by 3/5/2010. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (1 Certified copy to USM) (JSF)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER that defendant's attorney is authorized to retain a mental health professional to perform a presentence neuropsyhological evaluation of the defendant and to prepare a written report of the findings as to defendant Shawn A.
